intro: Memecylon obanense, commonly known as the Obanese memecylon, is a tropical shrub native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth seeds.
